external_database.name: FILER
external_database.description: The Functional genomics repository (FILER) is a resource developed at the University of Pennsylvania that provides a comprehensive, harmonized, extensible, indexed, searchable database of human functional genomics annotations collection across >20 data sources.

parameters.name: ROADMAP Epigenomics Project
parameters.description: The NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium is a public resource of human epigenomic data, which includes high-quality, genome-wide maps of several key histone modifications, chromatin accessibility, DNA methylation and mRNA expression across 100s of human cell types and tissues.  The core-15 state chromatin state learning subset defines significant combinatorial interactions between different chromatin marks in their spatial context (chromatin states) across 127 epigenomes, inferred using ChromHMM v1.10 (Ernst et al., 2012), which is based on a multivariate Hidden Markov Model.
